meanings.definition: Feeling or appearing calm and relaxed
meanings.sent1: She strolled through the park with a nonchalant attitude.
meanings.sent2: The cat lay in the sun, looking nonchalant and content.
meanings.sent3: Even when the cake fell, she remained nonchalant and simply laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: His nonchalant demeanor in the face of danger was both admirable and concerning.
meanings.sent5: The nonchalant way he handled the situation left a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of concern or enthusiasm
meanings.sent1: His nonchalant response to the news surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: She gave a nonchalant shrug when asked about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The nonchalant way he dismissed the important meeting was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her nonchalant attitude towards her responsibilities was starting to cause problems.
meanings.sent5: The student's nonchalant behavior in class was a cause for concern among the teachers.
